parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.abatementThresholdLevel1
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA abatementThresholdLevel1 parameter
parameters.description: Indicates the congestion abatement threshold level 1 for the internal queue from M3UA to SCTP. If during handling of the wouldblock situation (SEND FAILURE notification with the wouldblock result is received) the occupancy of the failover buffer becomes lower than the value of the abatement-threshold-level1 parameter, M3UA acts as if a CONGESTION CEASE notification is received.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.abatementThresholdLevel2
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA abatementThresholdLevel2 parameter
parameters.description: Indicates the congestion abatement threshold level 2 for the internal queue from M3UA to SCTP. If during handling of the wouldblock situation (SEND FAILURE notification with the wouldblock result is received) the occupancy of the failover buffer becomes lower than the value of the abatement-threshold-level2 parameter, M3UA acts as if a CONGESTION notification (level 1) is received.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.abatementThresholdLevel3
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA abatementThresholdLevel3 parameter
parameters.description: Indicates the congestion abatement threshold level 3 for the internal queue from M3UA to SCTP. If during handling of the wouldblock situation (SEND FAILURE notification with the wouldblock result is received) the occupancy of the failover buffer becomes lower than the value of the abatement-threshold-level3 parameter, M3UA acts as if a CONGESTION notification (level 2) is received.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile array
parameters.description:
Common configuration data for Application Server (AS).
Must be set as array<index> as follows:  ["dupu-behavior", "dupu-handling","id", "interval-for-mtp-status-ind", "notify-behavior", "time-divert", "timer-notify", "timer-scon", "timer-tr"] with falues like: ["dpc-omitted", "no-dupu-handling", "1", "8", "resume-after-aspac-ack", "10", "0", "75", "100"].
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.dupu-behavior
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, dupu-behavior parameter
parameters.description: Defines the way the parameter Concerned Destination is handled in the DUPU message.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.dupu-handling
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, dupu-handling parameter
parameters.description: Defines DUPU handling compliance.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.id
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, id parameter
parameters.description: The identifier of the AS profile.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.interval-for-mtp-status-ind
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, interval-for-mtp-status-ind parameter
parameters.description: The frequency of sending MTP-STATUS indication to user during congestion. For example if it is set to 2, M3UA sends MTP-STATUS indication for every second User Part message related to the congested DPC.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.notify-behavior
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, notify-behavior parameter
parameters.description: Defines the way the MTP-RESUME indication is sent to user. This parameter impacts local ASP associations only. In case of local IPSP this parameter is ignored.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.timer-divert
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, timer-divert parameter
parameters.description: Amount of time to wait for the last message on the other remote SP to be delivered until send of new messages. This parameter is used to avoid missequencing. Timer is started when SP enters or leaves Active state for a certain AS. Zero value means sending new messages immediately or discard if there are no active SP.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.timer-notify
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, timer-notify parameter
parameters.description: Amount if time to wait for Notify message with Active state before moving AS to Active state. This value is only of interest when notify-behavior is set to resume-after-notify. Zero value means to wait forever.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.timer-scon
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, timer-scon parameter
parameters.description: Timer to control the period when an M3UA destination is considered congested. Timer starts after receiving a SCON message with non-zero congestion status. Zero value means that timer is not started. It is not recommended to set the timer to zero, because congestion may never cease.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.asProfile.timer-tr
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA AS Profile, timer-tr parameter
parameters.description: Time spent to try to make a failover. During this time AS is able to go to Active state if SP serving it go to Active state.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.burstSize
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA burstSize parameter
parameters.description: Burst control parameter that limits the size of each message burst. Zero value means that bursting is disabled.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.checkDpcStatusInIpNetwork
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA checkDpcStatusInIpNetwork parameter
parameters.description: Defines whether M3UA checks the status of message OPC.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.congestionProcForRemoteSgps
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA congestionProcForRemoteSgps parameter
parameters.description: Defines congestion procedure when a SCON message is received from a Remote SGP.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM
parameters.comments: The value range applies to index values.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.forbidMessageFromUnknownDpc
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA forbidMessageFromUnknownDpc parameter
parameters.description: Defines whether M3UA checks the Point Code (PC) of the message originator.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.handleIncomDataMsgWithoutAs
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA handleIncomDataMsgWithoutAs parameter
parameters.description: Indicates whether M3UA processes incoming DATA messages without Application Server (AS). The parameter is only applicable for those remote IPSP and remote SGP for which discrimination of incoming M3UA DATA messages upon their Routing Labels is enabled (i.e. routing-context-handling is configured to e-sigtran-compliant or no-rc-handling).
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.internalCongestionLevel1
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA internalCongestionLevel1 parameter
parameters.description: Indicates the congestion level 1 for the internal queue from M3UA to SCTP. If during handling of the wouldblock situation (SEND FAILURE notification with the wouldblock result is received) the occupancy of the failover buffer becomes higher than the value of the internal-congestion-level1 parameter, M3UA acts as if a CONGESTION notification (level 1) is received. Zero value means that an MTP-STATUS indication (congestion level 1) is not issued due to internal congestion.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.internalCongestionLevel2
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA internalCongestionLevel2 parameter
parameters.description: Indicates the congestion level 2 for the internal queue from M3UA to SCTP. If during handling of the wouldblock situation (SEND FAILURE notification with the wouldblock result is received) the occupancy of the failover buffer becomes higher than the value of the internal-congestion-level2 parameter, M3UA acts as if a CONGESTION notification (level 2) is received. Zero value means that a MTP-STATUS indication (congestion level 2) is not issued due to internal congestion.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.internalCongestionLevel3
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA internalCongestionLevel3 parameter
parameters.description: Indicates the congestion level 3 for the internal queue from M3UA to SCTP. If during handling of the wouldblock situation (SEND FAILURE notification with the wouldblock result is received) the occupancy of the failover buffer becomes higher than the value of the internal-congestion-level3 parameter, M3UA acts as if a CONGESTION notification (level 3) is received. Zero value means that a MTP-STATUS indication (congestion level 3) is not issued due to internal congestion.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.loadsharingAlgorithm
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA loadsharingAlgorithm parameter
parameters.description: This parameter selects between two load sharing algorithms available for M3UA associations. If set to asymmetric, four remote Signaling Gateways (SGs) within each AS/DPC receive traffic load. This parameter is applied only for local ASP and ignored for local IPSP.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.maxNumberOfBurstsWithoutProgress
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA maxNumberOfBurstsWithoutProgress parameter
parameters.description: Defines the number of bursts after M3UA checks if buffer size is decreased. If buffer size decreased, M3UA restarts counting burst attempts. If buffer size has not decreased, M3UA will discard all buffered messages and resume normal handling of user traffic. This parameter is used for M3UA divert buffers.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.modifiedSlsRotation
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA modifiedSlsRotation parameter
parameters.description: Defines whether modified SLS 5-bit rotation is applied for the selected load sharing algorithm. If parameter modified-sls-rotation is set to enabled, local AS refers to Local Signaling Point with ANSI standard.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA remoteSpProfile array
parameters.description:
Common configuration data for remote Server Process (SP).
Must be set as array<index> as follows: ["assoc-establishment-attempts", "attempts-of-dauds", "drst-support", "heartbeat-procedure", "id", "max-num-of-affected-dpcs-in-daud", "ntfy-support", "timer-ack", "timer-assoc", "timer-audit", "timer-deactivation", "timer-hb", "timer-rec", "timer42","tmt-support"]. Default values are: ["4", "5", "rfc-4666-compliant", "hb-off", "1", "0","rfc-4666-compliant", "60","20","300","0","300","100","8","rfc-4666-compliant"]
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.assoc-establishment-attempts
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, assoc-establishment-attempts parameter
parameters.description: Number of attempts to send the ASSOCIATE request message. Zero value means sending infinite number of ASSOCIATE request.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.attempts-of-dauds
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, attempts-of-dauds parameter
parameters.description: The parameter defines the number of times M3UA attempts to send the DAUD. Zero value means sending infinite number of DAUD messages.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.drst-support
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, drst-support parameter
parameters.description: Defines handling of Destination Restricted (DRST) messages. RFC compliant behavior - DRST messages are handled on receiving. Ericsson Sigtran compliant behavior - DRST messages are never sent and answered with error (ERR) on receiving.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.heartbeat-procedure
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, heartbeat-procedure parameter
parameters.description: Defines if heartbeat procedure is activated or not.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.id
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, id parameter
parameters.description: The identifier of the remote SP profile.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.max-num-of-affected-dpcs-in-daud
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, max-num-of-affected-dpcs-in-daud parameter
parameters.description: Defines max number of affected Point Codes allowed in one DAUD message. If there are more affected PCs than this max, multiple DAUDs are sent. Zero value means no limitation on the number of affected PCs in DAUD.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.ntfy-support
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, ntfy-support parameter
parameters.description: Defines handling of notify (NTFY) messages. RFC compliant behavior - NTFY messages are sent and handled on receiving. Ericsson Sigtran compliant behavior - NTFY messages are never sent and ignored on receiving. If ntfy-support is set to e-sigtran-compliant, AS profile.notifyBehavior must be set to resume-after-aspac-ack.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.timer42
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, timer42 parameter
parameters.description: Time between resending of ASPUP and ASPAC messages after failed association activation attempt. Timer starts infinite number of times until association is activated. If timerAck expires during ASP Up or ASP Active procedures, timer42 is started. ASPUP or ASPAC request messages are resent after expiration of timer42.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.timer-ack
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, timer-ack parameter
parameters.description: Amount of time to wait for the acknowledgement of a message before considering an error. It must be greater than the time a message spends to reach the most distant destination, be processed, and return.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.timer-assoc
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, timer-assoc parameter
parameters.description: Amount of time to wait for the COMMUNICATION UP notification before considering association establishment attempt failed. It must be greater than the time a message spends to reach the most distant destination, be processed, and return.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.timer-audit
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, timer-audit parameter
parameters.description: Timer for Audit procedure. This is the amount of time to wait to send/resend DAUD messages towards the SGP to audit the state of SS7 destinations.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.timer-deactivation
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, timer-deactivation parameter
parameters.description: Amount of time to wait for ASPIA ACK before considering association removed during reconfiguration inactive. When the timer is expired the impacted association is closed even if no acknowledgement for association deactivation is received. Applicable only for remote SGPs with sctp-type equal to server/client-peer and remote IPSPs with configured IP addresses. Zero value means that an association can be deactivated upon the reception of acknowledgments from the remote side or notification from SCTP level only. If timer-reconfig is set to zero, the value of timer-deactivation is ignored.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.timer-hb
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, timer-hb parameter
parameters.description: Timer is used for the heartbeat procedures. Heartbeat Sending Procedure: every time a message is sent towards remote SP, timerHb is started. If it expires without sending a message to remote SP, a BEAT message is encoded and sent. In this way local M3UA peer informs that it is alive. Heartbeat Receiving Procedure is meant to detect at any time whether remote SP is alive. Every time a message is received from remote peer Heartbeat Receiving Timer (2 * timer-hb) is started. If it expires, remote peer is considered to be DOWN. If the local process is configured as client, after the expiration of Heartbeat Receiving Timer it makes an attempt to recover association by sending ASPUP.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.timer-rec
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, timer-rec parameter
parameters.description: Time delay between Automatic Reconnection procedures. It is started when SCTP association establishment fails assoc-establishment-attempts times in a row. When timer-rec expires, new attempts are performed assoc-establishment-attempts times.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.remoteSpProfile.tmt-support
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA Remote SP Profile, tmt-support parameter
parameters.description: Defines the usage of Traffic Mode Type (TMT). RFC compliant behavior - TMT is sent in ASPAC and ASPAC ACK messages. TMT is checked in incoming messages and ERR is sent in case of mismatch with the configured TMT. Ericsson Sigtran compliant behavior - TMT is never sent in ASPAC and ASPAC ACK messages. TMT is not checked in incoming messages.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.retransmitBufferSize
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA retransmitBufferSize parameter
parameters.description: Maximum size of the retransmit buffer. The buffer is used to store DATA messages returned in SEND FAILURE notification. Zero value means that returned messages are discarded. If both retransmit-buffer-size and timer-retransmit are set to zero, messages from SEND FAILURE notification are retransmitted immediately.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.supportDynamicRegistrOfAsp
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA supportDynamicRegistrOfAsp parameter
parameters.description: Defines whether Dynamic Registration and Dynamic Identification of remote SPs is supported.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.timerBurst
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA timerBurst parameter
parameters.description: Timer is used for burst control. Defines the resending time between each burst. Each part of data is sent after timer expiration.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.timerBurstJittering
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA timerBurstJittering parameter
parameters.description: Timer is used for burst control. Defines the resending time between each bDefines jittering value of timer-burst. timer-burst timer is started with the value: timer-burst - timer-burst * (timer-burst-jittering) / 100 + 2 * rand * timer-burst * (timer-burst-jittering) / 100 where rand is a random value between 0 and 1.urst. Each part of data is sent after timer expiration.
parameters.constraints: Values separated by space
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.timerCongAudit
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA timerCongAudit parameter
parameters.description: Time interval after which M3UA checks local congestion status of an association. The congestion status of associations is requested from SCTP. Zero value means that the timer is not started and lost primitives are never checked.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.timerInitConf
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA timerInitConf parameter
parameters.description: Time to wait for INITIALIZE confirmation during the initialization of a local SCTP Endpoint. If timer expires, timer timer-reinit is started.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-mapproxy.global.map.configuration.ss7.m3ua.timerReinit
parameters.functionality: Deployment parameter, SS7 M3UA timerReinit parameter
parameters.description: Timer to control the re-initialization of local SCTP Endpoint. If the initialization of local SCTP Endpoint fails, INITIALIZE request is sent after timer expiration.
parameters.dependencies: To be set if MAP  traffic is handled by CCSM

parameters.name: global.profiles.cleartext.enabled
parameters.description:
Set CCSM incoming/outgoing traffic mode in cleartext.
Note: even if outgoing traffic to a certain NF depends on the information provided by NRF for that NF, when cleartext is enabled, only http clear will be supported, as mTLS certificates will not be available. To avoid issues, check that peers are also registered in NRF to support http clear.
parameters.dependencies: No default value for cleartext.  Set value to false if mTLS connectivity is selected.

parameters.name: global.profiles.ipv4.enabled

parameters.name: global.profiles.ipv6.enabled

parameters.dependencies: No default value for IPv6.  Set value false if IPv4 connectivity is selected.

parameters.name: global.profiles.mtls.enabled
parameters.description:
Enable CCSM with mTLS capability for external traffic interfaces. 
Note: Outgoing traffic to a certain NF depends on the information provided by NRF for that NF, so even if this setting is enabled, we might have outgoing traffic towards a specific NF in http clear.
parameters.dependencies: No default value for mtls.  Set value false if cleartext connectivity is selected.

parameters.dependencies: No default value for small  deployment.  Set value false if standard  deployment is selected

parameters.name: global.pullSecret
parameters.description:
Secret name with credentials to access image registry
 
Note: When EO/EVNFM is used to deploy the CNF,  there is no need to provide this parameter since EVNFM will override this parameter to use EVNFM Docker registry
parameters.dependencies: Note: Parameter is mandatory when EO/EVNFM is not used.. When EO/EVNFM is used to deploy the CNF, there is no need to provide pullSecret and registry.url parameters since EVNFM will override them to use EVNFM Docker registry

parameters.name: global.registry.imagePullPolicy
parameters.description: Policy for container image pull. Note: Overriding the default value "IfNotPresent" with value "Always" implies that every time the container is started, the container image registry is queried. Therefore, if the container image registry is not reachable, the container will not start. This could affect several use cases, for example POD restart or POD autoscaling through HPA.
parameters.dependencies: Note: Parameter is mandatory when EO/EVNFM is not used.. When EO/EVNFM is used to deploy the CNF, there is no need to provide pullSecret and registry.url parameters since EVNFM will override them to use EVNFM Docker registry

parameters.name: global.registry.url

URL of the image registry

Note: When EO/EVNFM is used to deploy the CNF, there is no need to provide this parameter since EVNFM will override this parameter to use EVNFM Docker registry
parameters.dependencies: Note: Parameter is mandatory when EO/EVNFM is not used.. When EO/EVNFM is used to deploy the CNF, there is no need to provide pullSecret and registry.url parameters since EVNFM will override them to use EVNFM Docker registry

parameters.description: Enable forwarding of log messages to external lumberjack endpoints.

parameters.name: eric-adp-5g-udm.eric-log-transformer.egress.lumberjack.remoteHosts
parameters.description:
Array of external lumberjack host configuration.
Each lumberjack remote host consists of 
mandatory parameter: id, host, port, codec
id:  Must be a unique string. Recommended to be provided as ext-lj-X where X is a sequence number.
host: Hostname or IP address of remote host.
port: Port that remote host is listening to.
codec: How data is encoded. Typically json should be used but must be aligned with remote host. 
and 
optional parameter: filter rule or filter
filter rule:
exclusions: This is a filter that defines list of rules that will be used to match and include logs.
inclusions:  This is a filter that defines list of rules that will be used to match and exclude logs.
filter: This parameter defines a Logstash filter that reformats the log events sent to the remote lumberjack receiver.
parameters.constraints:
WARNING: 
No detailed guideline for filter syntax is provided. Please consult public reference documents for Logstash Filter plugins and verify it prior to production.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-adp.eric-pm-server.externalRemoteWrite
parameters.description:
Array of external Remote Write host configuration.
Each Remote Write host has the mandatory parameter: url
- url: url of external server to send samples to
and optional parameter: tls_config, queue_config and write_relabel_configs
- tls_config: This field is mandatory for TLS connection. It defines certificates file: ca_file, cert_file and key_file. This should be the same certificates as eric-adp-5g-udm.eric-pm-server.config.certm_tls
- queue_config: this configuration is to ensure the appropriate level of data flow and protect against blocking the buffer
- write_relabel_configs: relabeling applied to samples before sending them to the remote endpoint. This could be used to limit which samples are sent.
parameters.constraints:
WARNING: 
No detailed guideline for filter syntax is provided. Please consult public reference documents for prometheus Remote Write configuration and verify it prior to production.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-nrfagent.global.tapagent.enabled
parameters.description: Determines if the injection of vTAP agent sidecar for NRF Agen is enabled or not.
parameters.comments: The Tap Agent features for CCSM network functions and NRF Agent must be activated together, so global.vtapagent.enabled and eric-ccsm-nrfagent.global.tapagent.enabled should always be set to the same value.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-nrfagent.global.tapagent.egress_exclude_ips
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to specify the excluded IPs or IP ranges when tap NRF Agent egress traffic. Egress traffic towards these IPs will not be captured by tapagent. Use comma as separator between each item. 
It is suggested to set this parameter with Kubernetes Service Cluster IP Range (service-cluster-ip-range) and cluster CIDR (clusterCIDR) 
Note: Use command "kubectl describe pod kube-apiserver -n kube-system | grep service-cluster-ip-range" to get service-cluster-ip-range. 
Use command "kubectl -n kube-system get cm kube-proxy -o yaml | grep CIDR" to get k8s clusterCIDR.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-nrfagent.global.nrfagent.preferredNFType
parameters.description: This parameter is used by the NRFAgent to select the proper TLS certificate to be used in the common messages towards NRF. The correct value should be any of the NFs deployed and licensed, which should have a valid external certificate created. This certificate is the one used by the NRFAgent in the outgoing common messages towards NRF.
parameters.comments: Configuration of egress external certificates per NF

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-ausf.enabled
parameters.description: Determines if deploy AUSF Services
parameters.comments:
For most deployments this parameter should be used with its default value ("true"), which means it must be enabled if it has been licensed.
Set value to "false" only in case the function has been licensed and despite of that there is a need to disable it.
Changing the value from "false" to "true" is supported by means of configuration upgrade after the instantiation.
Changing the value from "true" to "false" is NOT supported by means of configuration upgrade - re-instantiation must be used instead.
Note: Consider that setting the value to "false" implies that the resources related to the disabled functionality are not installed, and as a result, related resources may be indicated as "missing" in CCSM logs.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-udm.enabled
parameters.description: Determines if deploy UDM Services
parameters.comments:
For most deployments this parameter should be used with its default value ("true"), which means it must be enabled if it has been licensed.
Set value to "false" only in case the function has been licensed and despite of that there is a need to disable it.
Changing the value from "false" to "true" is supported by means of configuration upgrade after the instantiation.
Changing the value from "true" to "false" is NOT supported by means of configuration upgrade - re-instantiation must be used instead.
Note: Consider that setting the value to "false" implies that the resources related to the disabled functionality are not installed, and as a result, related resources may be indicated as "missing" in CCSM logs.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-eir.enabled
parameters.description: Determines if deploy EIR Services
parameters.comments:
For most deployments this parameter should be used with its default value ("true"), which means it must be enabled if it has been licensed.
Set value to "false" only in case the function has been licensed and despite of that there is a need to disable it.
Changing the value from "false" to "true" is supported by means of configuration upgrade after the instantiation.
Changing the value from "true" to "false" is NOT supported by means of configuration upgrade - re-instantiation must be used instead.
Note: Consider that setting the value to "false" implies that the resources related to the disabled functionality are not installed, and as a result, related resources may be indicated as "missing" in CCSM logs.

parameters.name: eric-ccsm-hssims.enabled
parameters.description: Determines whether to deploy HSS-IMS Services or not
parameters.comments:
For most deployments this parameter should be used with its default value ("true"), which means it must be enabled if it has been licensed.
Set value to "false" only in case the function has been licensed and despite of that there is a need to disable it.
Changing the value from "false" to "true" is supported by means of configuration upgrade after the instantiation.
Changing the value from "true" to "false" is NOT supported by means of configuration upgrade - re-instantiation must be used instead.
Note: Consider that setting the value to "false" implies that the resources related to the disabled functionality are not installed, and as a result, related resources may be indicated as "missing" in CCSM logs.
